text: Robert John "Bob" Healey, Jr. (May 3, 1957 - March 20, 2016) was an American attorney, businessman, educator, restaurateur, and political activist. He was the founder of Rhode Island's Cool Moose Party. It is the state's third- largest political party from 1994 until 2002. He has been a perennial candidate for statewide office. ==Career== Healey has run for Governor or Lieutenant Governor a total of seven times. He ran as an independent candidate in 2010, he won 39% of the vote for Lieutenant Governor. He wanted to abolish the office. As the Moderate Party nominee for Governor in 2014, Healey won 22% of the vote while spending less than $40 on the campaign. ==Death== Healey was found dead in his bed at his home in Barrington, Rhode Island on March 20, 2016. He is believed to have died from a suspected heart attack in his sleep. He was aged 58. ==References== ==Other websites== * *Bob Healey's Campaign Journal â€“ A Guerrilla Guide to the Cerebral Revolution * Category:1957 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Businesspeople from Rhode Island Category:Educators from Rhode Island Category:American political activists Category:Boston University alumni Category:Columbia University alumni Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Politicians from Providence, Rhode Island Category:People from Barrington, Rhode Island Category:Lawyers from Rhode Island
title: Robert J. Healey
